ground_truth: She runs down the pier as the boat draws alongside. Nullah and Sarah peer through the smoke. The boy stands up on the prow of the boat and grins. He jumps up and down excitedly and runs off the boat onto the jetty. He runs up the wooden steps to the upper level of the wharf and sprints through the smoke towards Sarah. Nullah points and she turns slowly. There in the smoke stands the Drover. Their eyes meet and they walk slowly towards one another. Drover frowns in disbelief, then smiles and they embrace. They cling to each other, tears running down their cheeks. They break apart and look joyfully at one another, then kiss. Nullah runs up and hugs them both. Drover grins happily. The army sergeant sounds the horn of his truck and smiles. Dutton stops and stares at Sarah, Drover, and the boys. He's taken aback by her hug. The sergeant stomps up to the young priest. Fletcher grimly watches the boys, streaming towards the trucks. Sarah rests her head on Drover's shoulder and caresses his cheek. Dutton turns to them. Dutton smiles tearfully. He nods and walks away. Fletcher strides angrily towards the truck the boys are getting into. Dutton's the last on. The tailgate is raised and the trucks head off. Fletcher runs through the devastation, watched from the water tower by King George. Sarah's walking with Nullah. King George looks in horror as Fletcher grabs Bull's rifle. King George raises his arms in his magic-man stance as Fletcher advances with the rifle. King George watches Fletcher closely. Sarah smiles as Nullah runs towards the pub. Fletcher stands on top of a pile of wreckage and aims the rifle. Sarah spots the danger and, at the pub, Drover sees Fletcher. Drover runs for the boy. King George pulls a pipe off the water tower. Fletcher grimaces and Drover falls to the ground with Nullah. King George's pipe has run Fletcher through like a spear. King George glares at him. Drover strokes his hair. The unconscious boy's eyes flicker. Nullah grins. Fletcher tries to aim the rifle at King George. Fletcher winces and drops the rifle. Sarah reaches Drover and Nullah. Fletcher tries to speak and then collapses over a piece of wreckage. Sarah cuddles Nullah. Sergeant Callahan checks Fletcher's pulse. Sarah and Drover gaze into each other's eyes. They kiss, tenderly. Callahan walks away from Fletcher's body, across the wrecked King Carney cattle pen. Smoke hangs in palls over the destruction of Darwin. Drover drives the car in the sunshine, with Sarah and Nullah asleep next to him. Sarah picks up kindling for a fire in a field next to a river. She straightens and stares.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As she swiftly runs down the length of the pier, the boat gradually draws alongside it. Both Nullah and Sarah peer intently through the lingering smoke that clouds their vision. The boy, full of excitement, stands upright on the prow of the boat, his face breaking into a wide, cheerful grin. He jumps up and down with sheer joy and energy before running off the boat to the jetty. From there, he dashes eagerly up the wooden steps, reaching the upper level of the wharf where the smoke hangs thick. He sprints with determination toward Sarah. Meanwhile, Nullah points, prompting Sarah to turn slowly but surely. In the midst of the smoke, stands the Drover. Their eyes meet, locking in an unspoken understanding, and they slowly walk toward each other with deliberate steps. The Drover's initial frown conveys disbelief, which melts into a warm smile as they embrace wholeheartedly. Tears stream down their faces as they cling to one another in a tight embrace. They eventually draw apart, gazing joyously at each other before sharing a heartfelt kiss. Nullah enthusiastically runs up and wraps his arms around both of them, embracing them tightly. Drover's face lights up with a happy grin. The army sergeant, in the meantime, sounds the horn of his truck with a smile on his face. Dutton, stopping in his tracks, stares in astonishment at Sarah, Drover, and the boys gathered together. He's taken aback by the depth of emotion in her hug. The sergeant walks determinedly up to the young priest. Fletcher, on the other hand, watches the boys grimly as they stream toward the waiting trucks. Sarah finds comfort as she rests her head on Drover's shoulder, gently caressing his cheek. Dutton turns to face them. With tearful eyes brimming with emotion, he gives a nod of acknowledgment before walking away. Fletcher strides angrily toward the truck that the boys are climbing into. Dutton is the last to board. Once the tailgate is raised, the trucks begin their departure. Fletcher runs through the devastation, closely observed from the water tower by King George. Sarah and Nullah walk together. King George watches in horror as Fletcher seizes Bull's rifle. In response, King George raises his arms in his characteristic magic-man stance while Fletcher advances threateningly with the weapon. King George's gaze remains fixed on Fletcher's every move. Meanwhile, Sarah smiles fondly as Nullah runs eagerly toward the pub. Fletcher positions himself on top of a pile of wreckage and takes aim with the rifle. Sarah spots the imminent danger, and at the pub, Drover, too, sees Fletcher. Acting swiftly, Drover runs to protect the boy. King George, using his resourcefulness, pulls a pipe off the water tower. As Fletcher grimaces, Drover falls protectively to the ground with Nullah. King George's pipe has impaled Fletcher like a spear, and King George regards him with a fierce glare. Drover gently strokes Nullah's hair. The unconscious boy's eyes flicker open, revealing a grin spreading across Nullah's face. Fletcher tries to raise the rifle to aim at King George once more. However, he winces in pain and ultimately drops the rifle from his grasp. Sarah reaches Drover and Nullah, and they embrace. Fletcher attempts to speak, but fails, collapsing over the wreckage instead. Sarah comforts Nullah with a tender cuddle. Sergeant Callahan checks Fletcher's pulse with a practiced hand. Sarah and Drover share a moment as they gaze deeply into each other's eyes, culminating in a tender and loving kiss. Callahan walks away from Fletcher's lifeless body, crossing the wrecked King Carney cattle pen. Smoke continues to hang in palls, casting a shadow over the destruction of Darwin. Meanwhile, Drover drives the car under the warm sunshine, with both Sarah and Nullah resting peacefully asleep beside him. When Sarah picks up kindling for a fire in a serene field next to a flowing river, she straightens up and stares out into the distance.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As she rushes down the length of the pier, her feet pounding against the wooden planks, she is acutely aware of the boat gradually maneuvering closer alongside. Nullah and Sarah strain their eyes, squinting to peer through the thick, swirling smoke that obscures their view. The boy, positioned confidently on the prow of the boat, stands up and allows a wide grin to spread across his face. Bursting with excitement, he cannot contain his energy and begins to jump up and down with enthusiasm. In a swift, determined motion, he dashes off the boat and firmly plants his feet onto the jetty. Quickly, he ascends the wooden steps leading to the upper level of the wharf, his legs moving rapidly beneath him, and without hesitation, he sprints through the lingering smoke, eagerly making his way towards Sarah. As Nullah extends his arm to point, Sarah turns her head slowly, and her focus shifts. Within the hazy veil of smoke stands the Drover, a figure just becoming clear. Their eyes lock in a moment of recognition, and they begin to walk deliberately and slowly towards each other. Initially, the Drover's brows knit together in disbelief, a fleeting moment of astonishment crossing his face, but soon a smile breaks through, transforming his expression as they close the gap and embrace. They cling tightly to one another, overwhelmed with emotion, tears tracing paths down their cheeks. Reluctantly, they part, still holding onto the joy of their reunion, and they share a tender, heartfelt kiss. Nullah, unable to resist the moment, runs up and throws his arms around them both, and Drover responds with a wide, happy grin. Meanwhile, the army sergeant, with a lighthearted demeanor, sounds the horn of his truck and offers a smile. Dutton, pausing in his tracks, turns to observe Sarah, Drover, and the boys, momentarily stunned by the sight of her embrace. The sergeant, adopting a no-nonsense attitude, strides purposefully up to the young priest. As Fletcher watches grimly from a distance, the boys stream towards the waiting trucks. Sarah allows herself to relax, resting her head gently on Drover's shoulder, brushing her fingers softly against his cheek. Dutton, preparing to take his leave, offers a tearful smile, nods in acknowledgment, and begins to walk away. Meanwhile, Fletcher advances with anger in his steps towards the truck into which the boys are climbing. Dutton is the last to board, and as the tailgate is lifted and secured, the trucks rumble away. Fletcher, filled with a mix of emotions, runs through the devastation, his actions observed from the water tower by King George. Sarah, finding solace, walks alongside Nullah. King George, witnessing Fletcher's aggressive movements, watches in horror as Fletcher seizes Bull's rifle. Responding with determination and urgency, King George raises his arms, adopting his signature magic-man stance, keeping a vigilant watch as Fletcher advances. Apparently oblivious to the danger, Sarah smiles warmly as Nullah darts towards the pub. Fletcher, positioning himself atop a pile of wreckage, aims the rifle with intent. At the pub, Sarah notices the impending threat just as Drover catches sight of Fletcher. Without hesitation, Drover propels himself forward, racing to reach the boy. In a defensive maneuver, King George swiftly detaches a pipe from the water tower. In a tense and pivotal moment, Fletcher grimaces while Drover collapses to the ground alongside Nullah. King George's pipe has struck Fletcher with the force of a spear, pinning him down. With intense resolve, King George fixes his glare upon him. Drover reassures the unconscious boy, gently stroking his hair. The boy's eyes flutter, signs of life returning, and Nullah responds with a joyful grin. Desperately, Fletcher attempts to aim the rifle at King George, but his strength wanes, causing him to wince and relinquish his grip on the weapon, which clatters to the ground. Arriving at the scene, Sarah reaches Drover and Nullah, enveloping Nullah in her comforting arms. Fletcher struggles to form words, his energy fading, before he collapses over a piece of wreckage, motionless. As Sarah holds Nullah protectively, Sergeant Callahan approaches to check Fletcher’s pulse, confirming his fate. Seizing the moment of tranquility and intimacy, Sarah and Drover lock eyes, leaning in for a tender kiss, savoring their shared affection. Callahan, having completed his duty, walks away from Fletcher's lifeless body, making his way across the debris of the ruined King Carney cattle pen. Smoke continues to drift in thick, oppressive clouds over the devastation left in Darwin. Amidst this backdrop of destruction, Drover drives the car under the welcoming sun, where Sarah and Nullah, both exhausted, rest peacefully asleep beside him, the rhythm of the road soothing. Later, Sarah busies herself by picking up pieces of kindling for a fire in a serene field located next to a gently flowing river. She pauses in her task, straightens up, and allows her gaze to wander, lost in thought.

Smoke lingers over Darwin's devastation as Drover drives with Sarah and Nullah asleep beside him. In a tranquil field by the river, Sarah gathers kindling, then pauses to gaze ahead.

He nods and walks away, knowing they will find strength together. Fletcher strides angrily towards the truck the boys are getting into, fueled by unresolved rage. Dutton's the last on, ensuring all are accounted for. The tailgate is raised and the trucks head off towards a safer zone. Drover strokes his hair, reassuring the scared boy. The unconscious boy's eyes flicker, slowly coming back to reality. Nullah grins, feeling safe at last. Fletcher tries to aim the rifle at King George, but his body betrays him. Fletcher winces and drops the rifle, realizing he is overpowered. Sarah reaches Drover and Nullah, her relief palpable. Fletcher tries to speak and then collapses over a piece of wreckage, his final acts thwarted. Sarah cuddles Nullah, vowing to protect him. Sergeant Callahan checks Fletcher's pulse, confirming the end of his threat. Sarah and Drover gaze into each other's eyes, finding solace in their shared love. Drover drives the car in the sunshine, with Sarah and Nullah asleep next to him, heading towards a hopeful future. Sarah picks up kindling for a fire in a field next to a river, which promises a new beginning. She straightens and stares, contemplating the challenges and joys that lie ahead.

Dutton swivels to them. Dutton grins tearfully. He bobs his head and struts away. Fletcher strides furiously towards the van the youths are climbing into. Dutton's the last onboard. The ramp is lifted and the vans cruise away. Fletcher dashes through the desolation, observed from the lighthouse by King George. Sarah's strolling with Nullah. King George watches in terror as Fletcher snatches Bull's lantern. King George raises his arms in his ritual-man pose as Fletcher progresses with the lantern. King George observes Fletcher intently. Sarah beams as Nullah skips towards the tavern. Fletcher stands on top of a mound of rubbish and aims the lantern. Sarah notices the threat and, at the tavern, Drover spots Fletcher. Drover rushes for the youth. King George pulls a rod off the lighthouse. Fletcher grimaces and Drover tumbles to the ground with Nullah. King George's rod has run Fletcher through like a lance. King George scowls at him. Drover pats his hair. The unconscious youth's eyes flutter. Nullah beams. Fletcher attempts to point the lantern at King George. Fletcher winces and releases the lantern. Sarah arrives at Drover and Nullah. Fletcher attempts to utter words and then crumples over a piece of rubbish. Sarah snuggles Nullah. Sergeant Callahan checks Fletcher's heartbeat. Sarah and Drover gaze into each other's eyes. They peck, softly. Callahan saunters away from Fletcher's body, across the ruined King Carney storage yard. Haze suspends in drapes over the wreckage of Darwin. Drover maneuvers the bicycle in the daylight, with Sarah and Nullah dozing next to him. Sarah gathers pebbles for a garden in a meadow next to a creek. She stands straight and gazes.

It bounces up and down eagerly and skips off the submarine onto the dock. It dashes up the stone stairs to the top floor of the depot and zooms through the fog towards Oliver. Luna gestures and the turtle rotates slowly. There in the fog stands the Pilot. Their glances connect and they shuffle slowly towards each other. Pilot gawks in amazement, then beams and they cuddle. They clutch each other, raindrops trickling down their faces. They separate and gaze cheerfully at each other, then peck. Luna skips up and squeezes them both. Pilot beams joyously. The navy carpenter rings the bell of his motorcycle and beams. Sutton halts and gazes at Oliver, Pilot, and the kittens. He's astonished by her squeeze. The carpenter marches up to the old monk. Dexter solemnly observes the kittens, drifting towards the motorcycles. Oliver leans her brow on Pilot's chest and brushes his mane. Sutton pivots to them. Sutton grins mournfully. He bows and strides away. Dexter marches furiously towards the motorcycle the kittens are climbing into. Sutton's the last aboard. The cover is lifted and the motorcycles speed off. Dexter dashes through the chaos, observed from the windmill by Chief Albert. Oliver's strolling with Luna. Chief Albert watches in shock as Dexter seizes Bull's slingshot. Chief Albert lifts his hands in his wizard-man pose as Dexter advances with the slingshot. Chief Albert watches Dexter intently. Oliver beams as Luna sprints towards the inn. Dexter stands on top of a stack of debris and aims the slingshot. Oliver notices the peril and, at the inn, Pilot sees Dexter. Pilot dashes for the cat. Chief Albert yanks a rope off the windmill. Dexter winces and Pilot tumbles to the earth with Luna. Chief Albert's rope has struck Dexter down like an arrow. Chief Albert glowers at him. Pilot pats his paw. The unconscious cat's eyelids flutter. Luna smirks. Dexter attempts to aim the slingshot at Chief Albert. Dexter grimaces and drops the slingshot. Oliver reaches Pilot and Luna. Dexter tries to whisper and then crumbles over a chunk of debris. Oliver snuggles Luna. Artisan Marvin examines Dexter's wrist. Oliver and Pilot gaze into each other's souls. They peck, gently. Marvin ambles away from Dexter's figure, across the ruined King Charles pigsty. Fog lingers in shrouds over the ruins of Sydney. Pilot steers the train in the daylight, with Oliver and Luna dozing beside him. Oliver gathers branches for a bonfire in a meadow next to a stream. She stands upright and gawks.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As the boat arrives, Nullah and Sarah spot the Drover through the smoke. Nullah excitedly runs to Sarah, who turns to see Drover. They share a tearful embrace and kiss, joined by Nullah in a group hug. Dutton observes, moved, while Fletcher angrily watches the departing boys. Chaos ensues as Fletcher grabs a rifle, aiming at Nullah. King George intervenes, and Fletcher is incapacitated. Drover and Sarah protect Nullah, and Fletcher collapses. Callahan confirms Fletcher's death. Sarah and Drover share a tender moment, and the trio drives away, leaving the devastation behind. Sarah collects kindling near a river, pausing to reflect.
